title:
Slugs and Snails and Slimy Trails – Searching for Snails
in Chase Woods Conservation Area (Duncan)

attachments.displayName:
Slugs and Snails and Slimy Trails – Searching for Snails
in Chase Woods Conservation Area (Duncan)

Date: Saturday, November 9, 10:00 am – 2:00 pm
Meeting time: 10:00 am
Meeting place: Chase Woods parking area near the yellow gate
Register with Kate Wilson at kate.wilson@natureconservancy.ca

In the rare coastal Douglas-fir forests of southern BC, the stars of the wet season are brightly coloured slugs and snails eating beautiful mushrooms.

On Saturday, November 9th, join the Nature Conservancy of Canada on a walk through our Chase Woods property in the Cowichan Valley, where we will search for gastropods and other wildlife in a Douglas-fir forest. Learn about the biology and conservation of our native gastropods from the Nature Conservancy of Canada's own slug enthusiast, Kate Wilson, and improve your identification skills. We might even discover the endangered Blue-grey Taildropper, the Pacific Sideband snail (photo) and, of course, the charismatic Banana Slug. #events   #nature  #snails #slugs

In the rare coastal Douglas-fir forests of southern BC, the stars of the wet season are brightly coloured slugs and snails eating beautiful mushrooms. 

On Saturday, November 9th, join the Nature Conservancy of Canada on a walk through our Chase Woods property in the Cowichan Valley, where we will search for gastropods and other wildlife in a Douglas-fir forest. Learn about the biology and conservation of our native gastropods from the Nature Conservancy of Canada's own slug enthusiast, Kate Wilson, and improve your identification skills.
